Ministers, heads of departments of His Imperial Majesty's Own Chancellery, state controllers, state secretaries,
chief prosecutors of the Holy Synod). Article directory based on a substantial array of previously almost unpub-
lished material drawn from ten archives of St. Petersburg and Moscow (official lists and personal files of employees,
personal Imperial decrees, documents of the Department of Heraldry of the Senate approving the noble dignity
of the registers of the churches of St. Petersburg, documents, etc.). Detailed bibliographic lists are attached to
biographical articles, including 17 thematic headings. The appendix to the reference book contains chronological
lists of heads of departments, a genealogical index, an index of the places of birth of heads of higher and central
institutions, extensive lists of abbreviations.

Authors: Grachev A.N., Zabelkin S.A., Khaziakhmedova R.M.,
Valiullina A.L, Valeeva A.R., Makarov A.A., Bashkirov V.N.

G78 Technology of glued materials and wood boards / A.N. Grachev, S.A.
Zabelkin, R.M. Khaziakhmedova, A.I. Valiullina, A.R. Valeeva, A.A.
Makarov, V.N. Bashkirov, Ministry of Education and Science of Russia, Kazan
National Research Technological University. — Editorial and publishing center
«School», 2023. — 86 p.

ISBN 978-5-00245-097-8

The textbook contains brief characteristics of the types of glued
laminated wood; describes adhesives based on urea-, phenol-, resorcinol-,
melamine-formaldehyde resins, widely used in the woodworking industry.

The textbook also contains a list of laboratory works that cover the
main sections of the course, the necessary theoretical and background
information. Methods for calculating the main parameters characterizing a
particular technological operation and the equipment used in its implementation
are outlined.

It is intended for training of masters in the direction 18.04.01
"Chemical technology", studying the discipline "Equipment of enterprises for
the production of wood-based panels." It can also be used as a manual for
laboratory studies and self-study of the subject.

Prepared at the Department of Chemical Technology of Wood.

Selected works of the School of Erosion Studies by A. S. Kozmenko — G. P. Surmach in four
volumes. Vol. 4. — Volgograd: Federal Research Center of Agroecology of the Russian Academy of
Sciences, 2023. — 640 p.

Selected works of the Kozmenko —Surmach scientific School of Erosion Studies, which is over
100 years old, are published in four volumes. The works of the fourth volume show the continuity of scien-
tists from generation to generation. They set out the theoretical foundations of the meltwater runoff for-
mation, significantly clarifying the understanding of the hydrological processes physical nature, which al-
lowed a new interpretation of the conditions of meltwater seepage into frozen soil and improve existing as
well as develop new mathematical models. A quantitative relationship of runoff with factors has been es-
tablished, which made it possible to discover the law of limiting runoff factors and develop a high-precision
methodology for forecasting it. A new technology for managing the erosion-hydrological process has been
proposed. The role and place of agroforestry in soil protection agriculture have been determined.

Frolova O.A., Afonyushkin V.N. Eimeriosis of chickens. Modern aspects. —
M.: Akademiya Print, 2024. —166 p.

The monograph presents literature data and the results of our own research on
the risks of combined use of live attenuated pritovoeimerioznye vaccines "Evalon"
and "Eimeriavax 4M". Information is provided on the diagnosis of the disease, mod-
ern drugs against eimeriosis in chickens, vaccines, and drugs for the disinfection of
poultry premises. The monograph is intended for practicing veterinary specialists at
poultry farms, graduate students, and students of veterinary educational institutions.

Reviewers:

Gennady I. Petrov, Dr. Sci. (Eng.), Professor, Head of Wagons and
Wagons Facilities Department of the Russian University of Transport (MIIT);
Michael Yu. Kulikov, Dr. Sci. (Eng.), Professor, Head of Technology
of Transport Engineering and Repair of Rolling Stock Department
of the Russian University of Transport (MIIT)

The monograph is recommended for publication by the Scientific
and Consulting Centre of the Railway Research Institute

Samoshkin Sergey L., Naumenko Sergey N., Voron Oleg A., Solovyov Sergey A.

Generator-driver set of railway cars autonomous power supply systems:
monograph; edited by S. L. Samoshkin. — Moscow: PPC “KUNA”, 2024. —
240 p.

ISBN 978-5-98547- 147-2

The monograph examines the issues of using car generators drives on Passenger carriages
with an autonomous power supply system. The analysis of the development of car generator
drives is given, their classification is performed and requirements for their promising designs
are developed.

A description of the designs of serial drives, the kinematic scheme of which includes
a flat-belt or multi-strand V-belt transmission, is given. The analysis of the results of operation
and modernisation of serial drives over a long period of time is presented.

The types and designs of V-belts used at different times in passenger carriages drives are
considered. Methods of experimental determination of traction capacity, friction coefficient,
service life and geometric parameters of V-belts have been developed.

The results of experimental studies of traction capacity and statistical estimates of
the load of the most common mass-produced drives of car generators are presented.

Acomputational method for estimating the ultimate traction capacity has been developed,
considering the kinematic features of the drive design. An assessment of the obtained results is
presented and practical recommendations for improving traction and energy performance and
reliability of serial drives are developed.

Based on the research carried out by the authors, drive designs with new traction and
energy characteristics were developed and computational and experimental tests of prototypes
were carried out.

The book is intended for specialists of design and scientific organisations involved in
the design and computational and experimental research of new types of rolling stock cars, and
may also be useful for teachers and students of educational institutions of railway transport.

Editorial board:
A.B. Nevelev, Professor of the Department of Philosophy CSU, Ph.D., Professor;

V.S. Neveleva, Professor of the Department of Philosophy
of Chelyabinsk State Institute of Culture and Arts, Ph.D., Professor;

Sh.Sh. Khairulin, Candidate of Pedagogical Sciences, Associate Professor,
Head of Department 2 of Military and Political Work in the Troops (Forces) of the
Air Force Academy “Air Force Academy named after professor N.E. Zhukovsky
and Y.A. Gagarin” in Chelyabinsk;

A.Y. Kamaletdinova, Assistant Professor of Philosophy of CSU,

Ph.D., Associate Professor (scientific editor).

Human Being: the Problem of Unity in Diversity of the Modern
World: Proceedings of the X International Scientific Conference. Che-
lyabinsk: Chelyabinsk State University Publishing House, 2023. 333 p.

ISBN 978-5-7271-1944-0

The articles of the traditional X international scientific conference "Hu-
man Existence: the problem of unity in the diversity of the modern world"
(November, 2023), held within the framework of the Days of Science in the
Chelyabinsk region "Scientific Sovereignty — a vector of regional development"
and the Days of Philosophy in the Southern Urals, reflect the scientific inter-
est of philosophers of the Ural-Siberian region, the European part and new
the regions of Russia, the cities of Chelyabinsk, Magnitogorsk, Yekaterinburg,
Nizhny Salda, Khanty-Mansiysk, Moscow, St. Petersburg, the Republics of
Kazakhstan, Indonesia, the Republic of Azerbaijan and other countries to the
problems of human existence and its value world, the development strategy of
Russia. The collection of conference materials includes the section "Tribune of
the Young", which presents a philosophical vision of various aspects of being
by novice researchers.

Rabotnov L. D. The basics of physiology and pathology of the singer’s
voice : textbook / L. D. Rabotnov. — 6" edition, ster. — Saint Peters-
burg : Lan: The Planet.of-Music, 2024. — 224 p. : ill. — Text :
direct.
manual in the field of vocal methodology. In his book the author examines the
problems of voice production only from a physiological point of view. However,
each teacher, when studying and checking the achieved results and, perhaps, taking
the path of new research in the field of psychophysiology of singing and, in this
regard, in the field of vocal methodology, methodology and pedagogy, must have a
quite definite goal ahead: to educate such a singer, whose technique would not
represent a self-sufficient value, but serve as a means to deliver actual musical
material,

The textbook is intended for vocal teachers, singers and students studying the
vocal art.

Reviewers:

Honored Worker of Higher Education of the Russian Federation,
Doctor of Education, professor, head of the Department of Pedagogy
at S.M. Kirov Military Medical Academy A. V. Kozlov
Doctor of Education, professor at Peter the Great St. Petersburg
Polytechnic University A. E. Bolotin

Sushchenko V. P. Pedagogical and scientific methodological activity of a higher
education teacher in the field of physical education and sport : training manual / -
V. P. Sushchenko, V. A. Shchegolev, Sh. A. Kerimov. — St. Petersburg: POLY-
TECH-PRESS, 2023. — 248 c.

The training manual corresponds to the content of the federal discipline "Phy-
sical education and sport” of the state educational standard for the majors 49.04.01
"Physical education" and 49.06.01 "Physical education and sport", specialization
5.8.5 "Theory and methodology of sport”.

The authors consider the fundamentals of pedagogical and scientific methodo-
logical activity of a higher education teacher in the field of physical education and
sport. The focus is on the modern leading directions of pedagogical, scientific and
methodological activity of the teacher. The authors analyzed the factors that deter-
mine effectiveness of pedagogical and scientific methodological activity of specialists
in physical education and sport.

The training manual is intended for students, graduate students studying the his-
tory and modernity of physical education and sport, as well as for teachers working
in this field.

Table. 2. References.: 45 titles.

ve International Conference “Atomic Layer Deposition; Russia 2023” (ALD-Russia—2023),
Makhachkala, Russia, 15-18 Signs - 2023: book of af abatrapss- ~ Makhachkala: DSU Press, 2023. —
122 p.

ISBN 978-5-9913-0279-1

The abstracts proceeding contains the reports presented at the [Vth International Conference
"Atomic Layer Deposition: Russia-2023", organized by Federal State Budget Educational Institution
of Higher Education "Dagestan State University" and Saint-Petersburg State Institute of Technology
and held on the basis of the Scientific and raat cael Complex "Zhuravli" from September 15 to 18,
2023.

The reports in the abstracts proceeding present the besulls of research in the field of new thin-
film materials, improvement of the physicochemical properties of known materials, modification of
the surface by atomic and molecular layer deposition (molecular layering) techniques, as well as plas-
ma-assisted atomic layer deposition/etching. The issues of studying the properties and nature of the
growth of nanosized films obtained by atomic layer deposition by various physical methods, such as
ellipsometry, diffuse reflection spectroscopy, quartz crystal microbalance, etc., are considered. Vari-
ous topical applications of atomic layer deposition (molecular layering) technology and prospects for
the development of domestic infrastructure for creating own technological platforms for atomic layer
deposition are also considered.
